column4: to create DVD Video disks I've personally had the most luck with DeVeDe (it's in default repo)
I'd try booting with the nomodeset option, see if that makes any difference.  Good luck.
press a button (space maybe) at the first graphic of the LiveCD then I think you get an F6 option for boot options - nomodeset is in there.
OK ... I'll go back to 11.04 and try that
no go ... once I ran the installer, it goes to where it asks if I want third party software, I click forward, and then it's hung right there, just as before
sorry, I don't have any other suggestions.  Best of luck.
I guess I'll just have to ask on the forums
I found the problem ... the Ubuntu installer does not support GPT partition table
good work man.  I'm not even sure what GPT partitions are.  Glad you figured it out!
it's a requirement for drives (or RAID array created big drives) larger than 2TB
are you using Apple hardware by chance?
my drive is only 1TB ... just a cheap $300 box ... but I used GPT to get lots of partitions to make it a multiboot machine
GPT is certainly not required for multiboot...
no, but it is a lot easier when you are setting up 53 partitions
I worked around it by re-partitioning with MBR, giving it just the 4 partitions it will have ... I backed up the GPT and will restore it when done
at the same sectors, of course
